intro.description: I'm a neuroscientist passionate about understanding how our brains create consciousness, store memories, and shape our perception of reality.

sections.title: Research Focus
sections.content: My work centers on computational cognitive neuroscience, specifically investigating working memory mechanisms through EEG analysis and mathematical modeling. I'm fascinated by how the brain maintains and manipulates information in real-time, and how these processes break down in various neurological conditions.

sections.title: Science Communication
sections.content: Beyond the lab, I'm committed to making neuroscience accessible to everyone. Through writing, speaking, and digital content creation, I translate complex research into practical insights that can improve daily life.

sections.title: Holistic Approach
sections.content: I believe in bridging ancient wisdom with modern science. My exploration of Ayurveda and traditional medicine complements my neuroscience research, offering a more complete understanding of human health and consciousness.

degrees.institution: SISSA (International School for Advanced Studies), Trieste, Italy
degrees.details: Studying adaptability of Perceptual Working Memory and Neural Correlates. Supervisor: Prof. Mathew Diamond
